page.title: 12INTERESTING BUILDINGS 1.
page.content: Uckfield is a busy expanding town which has its roots back in the time when this area was the{great iron {foundry of England. Queen Elizabeth 1 stayed in Uckfield at an inn renamed{"The {Maidens Head"}in her honour during its heyday as a thriving iron centre. The inn is still an hotel. {The Parish Church}of the Holy Cross contains an excellent brass of John Fuller,one of the great iron founders. The oldest building, now cared for by the Uckfield and District Preservation Society,is{Bridge {Cottage}.It is a Wealden Hall house constructed by craftsmen between 1380 and 1430.The cottage is part of a redevelopment scheme which includes it as an exhibition centre and museum. Local interest and concern is providing the funds for this project.
